thread.title: Hunter named City Player of Year by coaches
thread.title_full: Hunter named City Player of Year by coaches

author: kyle.neddenriep@indystar.com
title: Hunter named City Player of Year by coaches
text:
Hunter named City Player of Year by coaches Kyle Neddenriep , kyle.neddenriep@indystar.com 8:31 a.m. ET Feb. 27, 2017 Buy Photo Tindley's Eric Hunter named City Player of the Year. (Photo: IndyStar) Buy Photo 156 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Tindley junior Eric Hunter was named the City Player the Year by the Coaches Association. 
Hunter, a 6-3 guard, is averaging 27.2 points, 7.3 rebounds and 3.2 assists this season for the Class A third-ranked Tigers (17-5). Hunter, the City’s Preseason Player of Year, was a first-team selection last year as a sophomore. 
Tindley’s Bobby Wonnell was named the City Coach of the Year. Wonnell, in his 10th season, will lead Tindley into sectional play on Tuesday against University in Sectional 58 at University. 
Here is the full All-City team: 
First team
